definition: below a usual or normal level or standard
examples: Why would a major football school fire a successful coach following a single subpar season?
Because of phylloxera, vineyards have been inconsistent and yielding subpar grapes.

definition: having a score lower than par
examples: His 19 birdies and two eagles gave him more subpar holes than anyone …
… Augusta National never played easier. … Saturday's 30 subpar rounds broke a third-round tournament record …
